current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relative to applying laws equally to the citizens of the United States and the Federal Government.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following joint resolution; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: That the following article is proposed as an amendment to the Constitution of the United States, which shall be valid to all intents and purposes as part of the Constitution when ratified by the legislatures of three-fourths of the several States:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall make no law applicable to a citizen of the United States that is not equally applicable to
shall make no law applicable to a citizen of the United States that is not equally applicable to the executive branch of Government, including the
, ambassadors, other public ministers and consuls, and all other officers of the United States, including those provided for under this Constitution and by law, and inferior officers to the
shall make no law applicable to a citizen of the United States that is not equally applicable to judges of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Supreme Court of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and judges of such inferior courts as Congress may from time to time ordain and establish.

text.#text: Nothing in this article shall preempt any specific provision of this Constitution.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SJ 25 IS: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relative to applying laws equally to the citizens of the United States and the Federal Government.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
